member.param: Null-terminated string containing the name of the file to save.

Pointer to the file handler used to write the file. The file is created by calling the AVIFileOpen function using this handler. If a handler is not specified, a default is selected from the registry based on the file extension.
Pointer to a callback function used to display status information and to let the user cancel the save operation.
Number of streams to save.
Pointer to an array of pointers to the AVISTREAM function structures. The array uses one pointer for each stream.
Pointer to an array of pointers to AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS structures. The array uses one pointer for each stream.
member.returns: Returns AVIERR_OK if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: This function is equivalent to the AVISave function except the streams are passed in an array instead of as a variable number of arguments.

This function creates a file, copies stream data into the file, closes the file, and releases the resources used by the new file. The last two parameters of this function are arrays that identify the streams to save in the file and define the compression options of those streams.
An application must allocate memory for the AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS structures and the array of pointers to these structures.
The argument ppavi contains the address of a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

For more information, see Conventions for Function Prototypes.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamAddRef(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream)
member.summary: The AVIStreamAddRef function increments the reference count of an AVI stream.
member.param: Handle to an open AVI stream.
member.returns: Returns the current reference count of the stream. This value should be used only for debugging purposes.
member.remarks: The argument pavi contains a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamBeginStreaming(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamBeginStreaming function specifies the parameters used in streaming and lets a stream handler prepare for streaming.
member.param: Pointer to a stream.
Starting frame for streaming.
Ending frame for streaming.

Speed at which the file is read relative to its natural speed. Specify 1000 for the normal speed. Values less than 1000 indicate a slower-than-normal speed; values greater than 1000 indicate a faster-than-normal speed.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.
member.remarks: The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.summary: The AVIStreamCreate function creates a stream not associated with any file.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives the new stream interface.
Stream-handler specific information.
Stream-handler specific information.
Pointer to the class identifier used for the stream.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: You should not need to call this function. Some functions, such as CreateEditableStream and AVIMakeCompressedStream, use it internally.
The argument ppavi contains the address of a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamCreate(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream@,System.Int32,System.Int32,Vanara.InteropServices.GuidPtr)

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamDataSize(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.UInt32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The AVIStreamDataSize macro determines the buffer size, in bytes, needed to retrieve optional header data for a specified stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Four-character code specifying the stream type.
Address to contain the buffer size for the optional header data.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamDataSize macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamDataSize(pavi, fcc, plSize) \ AVIStreamReadData(pavi, fcc, NULL, plSize)

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamEnd(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream)
member.summary: The AVIStreamEnd macro calculates the sample associated with the end of a stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
member.returns: Returns the number if successful or -1 otherwise.

remarks.para: The sample number returned is not a valid sample number for reading data. It represents the end of the file. (The end of the file is equal to the start of the file plus its length.)
The AVIStreamEnd macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamEnd(pavi) \ (AVIStreamStart(pavi) + AVIStreamLength(pavi))

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamEndStreaming(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream)
member.summary: The AVIStreamEndStreaming function ends streaming.
member.param: Pointer to a stream.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: Many stream implementations ignore this function.
The argument pavi contains a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamEndTime(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream)
member.summary: The AVIStreamEndTime macro returns the time representing the end of the stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
member.returns: Returns the converted time if successful or 1 otherwise.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamEndTime macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamEndTime(pavi) \ AVIStreamSampleToTime(pavi, AVIStreamEnd(pavi))

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamFindSample(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.FINDF)

summary.para: The AVIStreamFindSample function returns the position of a sample (key frame, nonempty frame, or a frame containing a format change) relative to the specified position.
This function supersedes the obsolete AVIStreamFindKeyFrame function.

member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Starting frame for the search.

param.name: lFlags
param.para: Flags that designate the type of frame to locate, the direction in the stream to search, and the type of return information. The following flags are defined.

item.term: Finds a nonempty frame. This flag supersedes the SEARCH_ANY flag.
Finds a key frame. This flag supersedes the SEARCH_KEY flag.

Finds nearest sample, frame, or format change searching forward. The current sample is included in the search. Use this flag with the FIND_ANY, FIND_KEY, or FIND_FORMAT flag. This flag supersedes the SEARCH_FORWARD flag.

Finds nearest sample, frame, or format change searching backward. The current sample is included in the search. Use this flag with the FIND_ANY, FIND_KEY, or FIND_FORMAT flag. This flag supersedes the SEARCH_NEAREST and SEARCH_BACKWARD flags.
Finds first sample, frame, or format change beginning from the start of the stream. Use this flag with the FIND_ANY, FIND_KEY, or FIND_FORMAT flag.

member.returns: Returns the position of the frame found or -1 if the search is unsuccessful.

remarks.para: The FIND_KEY, FIND_ANY, and FIND_FORMAT flags are mutually exclusive, as are the FIND_NEXT and FIND_PREV flags.
The argument pavi contains a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamFormatSize(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The AVIStreamFormatSize macro determines the buffer size, in bytes, needed to store format information for a sample in a stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Position of a sample in the stream.
Address to contain the buffer size.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamFormatSize macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamFormatSize(pavi, lPos, plSize) \ AVIStreamReadFormat(pavi, lPos, NULL, plSize)

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamGetFrame(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IGetFrame,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamGetFrame function returns the address of a decompressed video frame.
member.param: Pointer to the IGetFrame interface.
Position, in samples, within the stream of the desired frame.
member.returns: Returns a pointer to the frame data if successful or NULL otherwise. The frame data is returned as a packed DIB.
member.remarks: The returned frame is valid only until the next call to this function or the AVIStreamGetFrameClose function.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamGetFrameClose(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IGetFrame)
member.summary: The AVIStreamGetFrameClose function releases resources used to decompress video frames.
member.param: Handle returned from the AVIStreamGetFrameOpen function. After calling this function, the handle is invalid.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamGetFrameOpen(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.BITMAPINFOHEADER@)
member.summary: The AVIStreamGetFrameOpen function prepares to decompress video frames from the specified video stream.
member.param: Pointer to the video stream used as the video source.

Pointer to a structure that defines the desired video format. Specify NULL to use a default format. You can also specify AVIGETFRAMEF_BESTDISPLAYFMT to decode the frames to the best format for your display.

returns.para: Returns a GetFrame object that can be used with the AVIStreamGetFrame function. If the system cannot find a decompressor that can decompress the stream to the given format, or to any RGB format, the function returns NULL.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamGetFrameOpen(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The AVIStreamGetFrameOpen function prepares to decompress video frames from the specified video stream.
member.param: Pointer to the video stream used as the video source.

Pointer to a structure that defines the desired video format. Specify NULL to use a default format. You can also specify AVIGETFRAMEF_BESTDISPLAYFMT to decode the frames to the best format for your display.

returns.para: Returns a GetFrame object that can be used with the AVIStreamGetFrame function. If the system cannot find a decompressor that can decompress the stream to the given format, or to any RGB format, the function returns NULL.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamIsKeyFrame(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamIsKeyFrame macro indicates whether a sample in a specified stream is a key frame.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Position to search in the stream.
member.returns: if a sample in a specified stream is a key frame.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamIsKeyFrame macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamIsKeyFrame(pavi, lPos) \ (AVIStreamNearestKeyFrame(pavi, lPos) == 1)

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamLength(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream)
member.summary: The AVIStreamLength function returns the length of the stream.

returns.para: Returns the stream's length, in samples, if successful or -1 otherwise.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamLengthTime(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream)
member.summary: The AVIStreamLengthTime macro returns the length of a stream in time.

member.returns: Returns the converted time if successful or 1 otherwise.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamLengthTime macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamLengthTime(pavi) \ AVIStreamSampleToTime(pavi, AVIStreamLength(pavi))

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamNearestKeyFrame(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamNearestKeyFrame macro locates the key frame at or preceding a specified position in a stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Starting position to search in the stream.
member.returns: Returns the position of the frame found or -1 if the search is unsuccessful.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamNearestKeyFrame macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamNearestKeyFrame(pavi, lPos) \ AVIStreamFindSample(pavi, lPos , FIND_PREV | FIND_KEY)

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamNearestKeyFrameTime(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamNearestKeyFrameTime macro determines the time corresponding to the beginning of the key frame nearest (at or preceding) a specified time in a stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Starting time, in milliseconds, to search in the stream.
member.returns: Returns the converted time if successful or -1 otherwise.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamNearestKeyFrameTime macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamNearestKeyFrameTime(pavi, lTime) \ AVIStreamSampleToTime(pavi, AVIStreamNearestKeyFrame(pavi, AVIStreamTimeToSample(pavi, lTime)))

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamNearestSample(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamNearestSample macro locates the nearest nonempty sample at or preceding a specified position in a stream.

Starting position to search in the stream.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamNearestSample macro is defined as follows:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamNearestSampleTime(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)

Starting time, in milliseconds, to search in the stream.
member.returns: Returns the converted time if successful or 1 otherwise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamNextKeyFrame(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)

Starting position to search in the stream.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamNextKeyFrameTime(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)

Position in the stream to begin searching.

The AVIStreamNextKeyFrameTime macro is defined as follows:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamNextSample(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamNextSample macro locates the next nonempty sample from a specified position in a stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Starting position to search in the stream.
member.returns: Returns the position of the frame found or -1 if the search is unsuccessful.

remarks.para: The sample position returned does not include the sample specified by lPos.
The AVIStreamNextSample macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamNextSample(pavi, lPos) \ AVIStreamFindSample(pavi, lPos + 1, FIND_NEXT | FIND_ANY)

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamNextSampleTime(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamNextSampleTime macro returns the time that a sample changes to the next sample in the stream. This macro finds the next interesting time in a stream.

Position information of the sample in the stream.
member.returns: Returns the converted time if successful or 1 otherwise.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamNextSampleTime macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamNextSampleTime(pavi, time) \ AVIStreamSampleToTime(pavi, \ AVIStreamNextSample(pavi, \ AVIStreamTimeToSample(pavi, t)))

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamOpenFromFile(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream@,System.String,System.UInt32,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.Kernel32.OpenFileAction,System.Guid@)
member.summary: The AVIStreamOpenFromFile function opens a single stream from a file.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives the new stream handle.
Null-terminated string containing the name of the file to open.

param.name: fccType
param.para: Four-character code indicating the type of stream to be opened. Zero indicates that any stream can be opened. The following definitions apply to the data commonly found in AVI streams:

member.param: Stream of the type specified in fccType to access. This parameter is zero-based; use zero to specify the first occurrence.

Access mode to use when opening the file. This function can open only existing streams, so the OF_CREATE mode flag cannot be used. For more information about the available flags for the mode parameter, see the OpenFile function.
Pointer to a class identifier of the handler you want to use. If the value is NULL, the system chooses one from the registry based on the file extension or the file RIFF type.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: This function calls the AVIFileOpen, AVIFileGetStream, and AVIFileRelease functions.

para.para: Note

The vfw.h header defines AVIStreamOpenFromFile as an alias which automatically selects the ANSI or Unicode version of this function based on the definition of the UNICODE preprocessor constant. Mixing usage of the encoding-neutral alias with code that not encoding-neutral can lead to mismatches that result in compilation or runtime errors. For more information, see Conventions for Function Prototypes.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamRead(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The AVIStreamRead function reads audio, video or other data from a stream according to the stream type.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
First sample to read.
Number of samples to read. You can also specify the value AVISTREAMREAD_CONVENIENT to let the stream handler determine the number of samples to read.
Pointer to a buffer to contain the data.
Size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by lpBuffer.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the number of bytes of data written in the buffer referenced by lpBuffer. This value can be NULL.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the number of samples written in the buffer referenced by lpBuffer. This value can be NULL.

returns.para: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise. Possible error values include the following.

item.term: The buffer size cbBuffer was smaller than a single sample of data.
There was not enough memory to complete the read operation.
A disk error occurred while reading the file.

remarks.para: If lpBuffer is NULL, this function does not read any data; it returns information about the size of data that would be read.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamReadData(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The AVIStreamReadData function reads optional header data from a stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Four-character code identifying the data.
Pointer to the buffer to contain the optional header data.
Pointer to the location that specifies the buffer size used for lpData. If the read is successful, AVIFile changes this value to indicate the amount of data written into the buffer for lpData.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise. The return value AVIERR_NODATA indicates the system could not find any data with the specified chunk identifier.

remarks.para: This function retrieves only optional header information from the stream. This information is custom and does not have a set format.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamReadFormat(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The AVIStreamReadFormat function reads the stream format data.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Position in the stream used to obtain the format data.
Pointer to a buffer to contain the format data.

Pointer to a location indicating the size of the memory block referenced by lpFormat. On return, the value is changed to indicate the amount of data read. If lpFormat is NULL, this parameter can be used to obtain the amount of memory needed to return the format.

returns.para: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.remarks: Standard video stream handlers provide format information in a BITMAPINFOHEADER structure. Standard audio stream handlers provide format information in a PCMWAVEFORMAT structure. Other data streams can use other structures that describe the stream data.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamRelease(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream)

summary.para: The AVIStreamRelease function decrements the reference count of an AVI stream interface handle, and closes the stream if the count reaches zero.
This function supersedes the obsolete AVIStreamClose function.

member.param: Handle to an open stream.

returns.para: Returns the current reference count of the stream. This value should be used only for debugging purposes.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamSampleSize(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The AVIStreamRelease macro determines the size of the buffer needed to store one sample of information from a stream. The size corresponds to the sample at the position specified by lPos.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Position of a sample in the stream.
Address to contain the buffer size.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamSampleSize macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamSampleSize(pavi, lPos, plSize) \ AVIStreamRead(pavi, lPos, 1, NULL, 0, plSize, NULL)

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamSampleToSample(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamSampleToSample macro returns the sample in a stream that occurs at the same time as a sample that occurs in a second stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream that contains the sample that is returned.
Handle to a second stream that contains the reference sample.
Position information of the sample in the stream referenced by pavi2.
member.returns: Returns the converted time if successful or -1 otherwise.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamSampleToSample macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamSampleToSample(pavi1, pavi2, lsample) \ AVIStreamTimeToSample(pavi1, AVIStreamSampleToTime \ (pavi2, lsample))

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamSampleToTime(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamSampleToTime function converts a stream position from samples to milliseconds.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Position information. A sample can correspond to blocks of audio, a video frame, or other format, depending on the stream type.
member.returns: Returns the converted time if successful or 1 otherwise.
member.remarks: The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamSetFormat(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamSetFormat function sets the format of a stream at the specified position.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Position in the stream to receive the format.
Pointer to a structure containing the new format.
Size, in bytes, of the block of memory referenced by lpFormat.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: The handler for writing AVI files does not accept format changes. Besides setting the initial format for a stream, only changes in the palette of a video stream are allowed in an AVI file. The palette change must occur after any frames already written to the AVI file. Other handlers might impose different restrictions.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamStart(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream)
member.summary: The AVIStreamStart function returns the starting sample number for the stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
member.returns: Returns the number if successful or -1 otherwise.
member.remarks: The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamStartTime(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream)
member.summary: The AVIStreamStartTime macro returns the starting time of a stream's first sample.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.

remarks.para: The AVIStreamStartTime macro is defined as follows:

para.code: #define AVIStreamStartTime(pavi) \ AVIStreamSampleToTime(pavi, AVIStreamStart(pavi))

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamTimeToSample(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamTimeToSample function converts from milliseconds to samples.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Time, expressed in milliseconds.
member.returns: Returns the converted time if successful or -1 otherwise.

remarks.para: Samples typically correspond to audio samples or video frames. Other stream types might support different formats than these.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamWrite(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIIF,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The AVIStreamWrite function writes data to a stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
First sample to write.
Number of samples to write.
Pointer to a buffer containing the data to write.
Size of the buffer referenced by lpBuffer.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Flag associated with this data. The following flag is defined:

item.term: Indicates this data does not rely on preceding data in the file.

member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives the number of samples written. This can be set to NULL.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the number of bytes written. This can be set to NULL.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: The default AVI file handler supports writing only at the end of a stream. The "WAVE" file handler supports writing anywhere.
This function overwrites existing data, rather than inserting new data.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIStreamWriteData(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The AVIStreamWriteData function writes optional header information to the stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
Four-character code identifying the data.
Pointer to a buffer containing the data to write.
Number of bytes of data to write into the stream.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise. The return value AVIERR_READONLY indicates the file was opened without write access.

remarks.para: Use the AVIStreamWrite function to write the multimedia content of the stream. Use AVIFileWriteData to write data that applies to an entire file.
The argument pavi is a pointer to an IAVIStream interface.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.aviTWOCC(System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Macro to make a TWOCC out of two characters
member.param: The first character.
The second character.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CreateEditableStream(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream@,Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream)
member.summary: The CreateEditableStream function creates an editable stream. Use this function before using other stream editing functions.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives the new stream handle.
Handle to the stream supplying data for the new stream. Specify NULL to create an empty editable string that you can copy and paste data into.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: The stream pointer returned in ppsEditable must be used as the source stream in the other stream editing functions.

Internally, this function creates tables to keep track of changes to a stream. The original stream is never changed by the stream editing functions. The stream pointer created by this function can be used in any AVIFile function that accepts stream pointers. You can use this function on the same stream multiple times. A copy of a stream is not affected by changes in another copy.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.EditStreamClone(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream@)
member.summary: The EditStreamClone function creates a duplicate editable stream.
member.param: Handle to an editable stream that will be copied.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the new stream handle.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: The editable stream that is being cloned must have been created by the CreateEditableStream function or one of the stream editing functions.
The new stream can be treated as any other AVI stream.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.EditStreamCopy(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream@)
member.summary: The EditStreamCopy function copies an editable stream (or a portion of it) into a temporary stream.
member.param: Handle to the stream being copied.
Starting position within the stream being copied. The starting position is returned.
Amount of data to copy from the stream referenced by pavi. The length of the copied data is returned.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the handle created for the new stream.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: The stream that is copied must be created by the CreateEditableStream function or one of the stream editing functions.
The temporary stream can be treated as any other AVI stream.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.EditStreamCut(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream@)
member.summary: The EditStreamCut function deletes all or part of an editable stream and creates a temporary editable stream from the deleted portion of the stream.
member.param: Handle to the stream being edited.
Starting position of the data to cut from the stream referenced by pavi.
Amount of data to cut from the stream referenced by pavi.
Pointer to the handle created for the new stream.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: The stream being edited must have been created by the CreateEditableStream function or one of the stream editing functions.
The temporary stream is an editable stream and can be treated as any other AVI stream. An application must release the temporary stream to free the resources associated with it.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.EditStreamPaste(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The EditStreamPaste function copies a stream (or a portion of it) from one stream and pastes it within another stream at a specified location.
member.param: Handle to an editable stream that will receive the copied stream data.
Starting position to paste the data within the destination stream (referenced by pavi).
Pointer to a buffer that receives the amount of data pasted in the stream.
Handle to a stream supplying the data to paste. This stream does not need to be an editable stream.
Starting position of the data to copy within the source stream.
Amount of data to copy from the source stream. If lLength is -1, the entire stream referenced by pstream is pasted in the other stream.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: The stream referenced by pavi must have been created by the CreateEditableStream function or one of the stream editing functions.

This function inserts data into the specified stream as a continuous block of data. It opens the specified data stream at the insertion point, pastes the specified stream segment at the insertion point, and appends the stream segment that trails the insertion point to the end of pasted segment.

The function changes the following members:

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS
member.summary: The AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS structure contains information about a stream and how it is compressed and saved. This structure passes data to the AVIMakeCompressedStream function (or the AVISave function, which uses AVIMakeCompressedStream).

summary.para: Four-character code indicating the stream type. The following constants have been defined for the data commonly found in AVI streams:

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.fccHandler
member.summary: Four-character code for the compressor handler that will compress this video stream when it is saved (for example, mmioFOURCC ('M','S','V','C')). This member is not used for audio streams.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.dwKeyFrameEvery
member.summary: Maximum period between video key frames. This member is used only if the AVICOMPRESSF_KEYFRAMES flag is set; otherwise every video frame is a key frame.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.dwQuality
member.summary: Quality value passed to a video compressor. This member is not used for an audio compressor.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.dwBytesPerSecond
member.summary: Video compressor data rate. This member is used only if the AVICOMPRESSF_DATARATE flag is set.

summary.para: Flags used for compression. The following values are defined:

item.term: Compresses this video stream using the data rate specified in dwBytesPerSecond.
Interleaves this stream every dwInterleaveEvery frames with respect to the first stream.
Saves this video stream with key frames at least every dwKeyFrameEvery frames. By default, every frame will be a key frame.
Uses the data in this structure to set the default compression values for AVISaveOptions. If an empty structure is passed and this flag is not set, some defaults will be chosen.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.lpFormat
member.summary: Pointer to a structure defining the data format. For an audio stream, this is an LPWAVEFORMAT structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.cbFormat
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the data referenced by lpFormat.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.lpParms
member.summary: Video-compressor-specific data; used internally.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.cbParms
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the data referenced by lpParms

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.dwInterleaveEvery
member.summary: Interleave factor for interspersing stream data with data from the first stream. Used only if the AVICOMPRESSF_INTERLEAVE flag is set.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIFILEINFO
member.summary: The AVIFILEINFO structure contains global information for an entire AVI file.

remarks.para: Note

The vfw.h header defines AVIFILEINFO as an alias which automatically selects the ANSI or Unicode version of this function based on the definition of the UNICODE preprocessor constant. Mixing usage of the encoding-neutral alias with code that not encoding-neutral can lead to mismatches that result in compilation or runtime errors. For more information, see Conventions for Function Prototypes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIFILEINFO.dwMaxBytesPerSec
member.summary: Approximate maximum data rate of the AVI file.

summary.para: A bitwise OR of zero or more flags. The following flags are defined:

item.term: The AVI file has an index at the end of the file. For good performance, all AVI files should contain an index.

The file index contains the playback order for the chunks in the file. Use the index rather than the physical ordering of the chunks when playing back the data. This could be used for creating a list of frames for editing.

The AVI file is a specially allocated file used for capturing real-time video. Applications should warn the user before writing over a file with this flag set because the user probably defragmented this file.
The AVI file contains copyrighted data and software. When this flag is used, software should not permit the data to be duplicated.

summary.para: Capability flags. The following flags are defined:

item.term: An application can open the AVI file with the read privilege.
An application can open the AVI file with the write privilege.
Every frame in the AVI file is a key frame.
The AVI file does not use a compression method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIFILEINFO.dwStreams
member.summary: Number of streams in the file. For example, a file with audio and video has at least two streams.

summary.para: Suggested buffer size, in bytes, for reading the file. Generally, this size should be large enough to contain the largest chunk in the file. For an interleaved file, this size should be large enough to read an entire record, not just a chunk.
If the buffer size is too small or is set to zero, the playback software will have to reallocate memory during playback, reducing performance.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIFILEINFO.dwWidth
member.summary: Width, in pixels, of the AVI file.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIFILEINFO.dwHeight
member.summary: Height, in pixels, of the AVI file.

summary.para: Time scale applicable for the entire file. Dividing dwRate by dwScale gives the number of samples per second.
Any stream can define its own time scale to supersede the file time scale.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIFILEINFO.dwRate
member.summary: Rate in an integer format. To obtain the rate in samples per second, divide this value by the value in dwScale.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIFILEINFO.dwLength
member.summary: Length of the AVI file. The units are defined by dwRate and dwScale.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIFILEINFO.dwEditCount
member.summary: Number of streams that have been added to or deleted from the AVI file.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIFILEINFO.szFileType
member.summary: Null-terminated string containing descriptive information for the file type.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO
member.summary: The AVISTREAMINFO structure contains information for a single stream.

remarks.para: Note

The vfw.h header defines AVISTREAMINFO as an alias which automatically selects the ANSI or Unicode version of this function based on the definition of the UNICODE preprocessor constant. Mixing usage of the encoding-neutral alias with code that not encoding-neutral can lead to mismatches that result in compilation or runtime errors. For more information, see Conventions for Function Prototypes.

summary.para: Four-character code indicating the stream type. The following constants have been defined for the data commonly found in AVI streams:

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.fccHandler
member.summary: Four-character code of the compressor handler that will compress this video stream when it is saved (for example, mmioFOURCC ('M','S','V','C')). This member is not used for audio streams.

summary.para: Applicable flags for the stream. The bits in the high-order word of these flags are specific to the type of data contained in the stream. The following flags are defined:

item.term: Indicates this stream should be rendered when explicitly enabled by the user.
Indicates this video stream contains palette changes. This flag warns the playback software that it will need to animate the palette.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.dwCaps
member.summary: Capability flags; currently unused.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.wPriority
member.summary: Priority of the stream.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.wLanguage
member.summary: Language of the stream.

summary.para: Time scale applicable for the stream. Dividing dwRate by dwScale gives the playback rate in number of samples per second.

For video streams, this rate should be the frame rate. For audio streams, this rate should correspond to the audio block size (the nBlockAlign member of the WAVEFORMAT or PCMWAVEFORMAT structure), which for PCM (Pulse Code Modulation) audio reduces to the sample rate.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.dwRate
member.summary: Rate in an integer format. To obtain the rate in samples per second, divide this value by the value in dwScale.

summary.para: Sample number of the first frame of the AVI file. The units are defined by dwRate and dwScale. Normally, this is zero, but it can specify a delay time for a stream that does not start concurrently with the file.
The 1.0 release of the AVI tools does not support a nonzero starting time.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.dwLength
member.summary: Length of this stream. The units are defined by dwRate and dwScale.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.dwInitialFrames
member.summary: Audio skew. This member specifies how much to skew the audio data ahead of the video frames in interleaved files. Typically, this is about 0.75 seconds.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.dwSuggestedBufferSize
member.summary: Recommended buffer size, in bytes, for the stream. Typically, this member contains a value corresponding to the largest chunk in the stream. Using the correct buffer size makes playback more efficient. Use zero if you do not know the correct buffer size.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.dwQuality
member.summary: Quality indicator of the video data in the stream. Quality is represented as a number between 0 and 10,000. For compressed data, this typically represents the value of the quality parameter passed to the compression software. If set to 1, drivers use the default quality value.

summary.para: Size, in bytes, of a single data sample. If the value of this member is zero, the samples can vary in size and each data sample (such as a video frame) must be in a separate chunk. A nonzero value indicates that multiple samples of data can be grouped into a single chunk within the file.

For video streams, this number is typically zero, although it can be nonzero if all video frames are the same size. For audio streams, this number should be the same as the nBlockAlign member of the WAVEFORMAT or WAVEFORMATEX structure describing the audio.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.rcFrame
member.summary: Dimensions of the video destination rectangle. The values represent the coordinates of upper left corner, the height, and the width of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.dwEditCount
member.summary: Number of times the stream has been edited. The stream handler maintains this count.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.dwFormatChangeCount
member.summary: Number of times the stream format has changed. The stream handler maintains this count.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVISTREAMINFO.szName
member.summary: Null-terminated string containing a description of the stream.

member.summary: Flags for VIDEOHDR

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.VHDR.VHDR_KEYFRAME

summary.para: The CAPDRIVERCAPS structure defines the capabilities of the capture driver.

An application should use the WM_CAP_DRIVER_GET_CAPS message or capDriverGetCaps macro to place a copy of the driver capabilities in a CAPDRIVERCAPS structure whenever the application connects a capture window to a capture driver.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.wDeviceIndex
member.summary: Index of the capture driver. An index value can range from 0 to 9.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.fHasOverlay
member.summary: Video-overlay flag. The value of this member is TRUE if the device supports video overlay.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.fHasDlgVideoSource
member.summary: Video source dialog flag. The value of this member is TRUE if the device supports a dialog box for selecting and controlling the video source.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.fHasDlgVideoFormat
member.summary: Video format dialog flag. The value of this member is TRUE if the device supports a dialog box for selecting the video format.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.fHasDlgVideoDisplay
member.summary: Video display dialog flag. The value of this member is TRUE if the device supports a dialog box for controlling the redisplay of video from the capture frame buffer.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.fCaptureInitialized
member.summary: Capture initialization flag. The value of this member is TRUE if a capture device has been successfully connected.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.fDriverSuppliesPalettes
member.summary: Driver palette flag. The value of this member is TRUE if the driver can create palettes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.hVideoIn
member.summary: Not used in Win32 applications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.hVideoOut
member.summary: Not used in Win32 applications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.hVideoExtIn
member.summary: Not used in Win32 applications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPDRIVERCAPS.hVideoExtOut
member.summary: Not used in Win32 applications.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPINFOCHUNK
member.summary: The CAPINFOCHUNK structure contains parameters that can be used to define an information chunk within an AVI capture file. The WM_CAP_FILE_SET_INFOCHUNK message or capSetInfoChunk macro is used to send a CAPINFOCHUNK structure to a capture window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPINFOCHUNK.fccInfoID
member.summary: Four-character code that identifies the representation of the chunk data. If this value is NULL and lpData is NULL, all accumulated information chunks are deleted.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPINFOCHUNK.lpData
member.summary: Pointer to the data. If this value is NULL, all fccInfoID information chunks are deleted.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPINFOCHUNK.cbData
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the data pointed to by lpData. If lpData specifies a null-terminated string, use the string length incremented by one to save the NULL with the string.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS
member.summary: The CAPSTATUS structure defines the current state of the capture window.
member.remarks: Because the state of a capture window changes in response to various messages, an application should update the information in this structure whenever it needs to enable menu items, determine the actual state of the capture window, or call the video format dialog box. If the application yields during streaming capture, this structure returns the progress of the capture in the dwCurrentVideoFrame, dwCurrentVideoFramesDropped, dwCurre ntWaveSamples, and dwCurrentTimeElapsedMS members. Use the WM_CAP_GET_STATUS message or capGetStatus macro to update the contents of this structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.uiImageWidth
member.summary: Image width, in pixels.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.uiImageHeight
member.summary: Image height, in pixels

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.fLiveWindow
member.summary: Live window flag. The value of this member is TRUE if the window is displaying video using the preview method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.fOverlayWindow
member.summary: Overlay window flag. The value of this member is TRUE if the window is displaying video using hardware overlay.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.fScale
member.summary: Input scaling flag. The value of this member is TRUE if the window is scaling the input video to the client area when displaying video using preview. This parameter has no effect when displaying video using overlay.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.ptScroll
member.summary: The x- and y-offset of the pixel displayed in the upper left corner of the client area of the window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.fUsingDefaultPalette
member.summary: Default palette flag. The value of this member is TRUE if the capture driver is using its default palette.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.fAudioHardware
member.summary: Audio hardware flag. The value of this member is TRUE if the system has waveform-audio hardware installed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.fCapFileExists
member.summary: Capture file flag. The value of this member is TRUE if a valid capture file has been generated.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.dwCurrentVideoFrame
member.summary: Number of frames processed during the current (or most recent) streaming capture. This count includes dropped frames.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.dwCurrentVideoFramesDropped
member.summary: Number of frames dropped during the current (or most recent) streaming capture. Dropped frames occur when the capture rate exceeds the rate at which frames can be saved to file. In this case, the capture driver has no buffers available for storing data. Dropping frames does not affect synchronization because the previous frame is displayed in place of the dropped frame.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.dwCurrentWaveSamples
member.summary: Number of waveform-audio samples processed during the current (or most recent) streaming capture.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.dwCurrentTimeElapsedMS
member.summary: Time, in milliseconds, since the start of the current (or most recent) streaming capture.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.hPalCurrent
member.summary: Handle to current palette.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.fCapturingNow
member.summary: Capturing flag. The value of this member is TRUE when capturing is in progress.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.dwReturn
member.summary: Error return values. Use this member if your application does not support an error callback function.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.wNumVideoAllocated
member.summary: Number of video buffers allocated. This value might be less than the number specified in the wNumVideoRequested member of the CAPTUREPARMS structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPSTATUS.wNumAudioAllocated
member.summary: Number of audio buffers allocated. This value might be less than the number specified in the wNumAudioRequested member of the CAPTUREPARMS structure.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS
member.summary: The CAPTUREPARMS structure contains parameters that control the streaming video capture process. This structure is used to get and set parameters that affect the capture rate, the number of buffers to use while capturing, and how capture is terminated.

remarks.para: The WM_CAP_GET_SEQUENCE_SETUP message or capCaptureGetSetup macro is used to retrieve the current capture parameters. The WM_CAP_SET_SEQUENCE_SETUP message or capCaptureSetSetup macro is used to set the capture parameters.

The WM_CAP_GET_SEQUENCE_SETUP message or capCaptureGetSetup macro is used to retrieve the current capture parameters. The WM_CAP_SET_SEQUENCE_SETUP message or capCaptureSetSetup macro is used to set the capture parameters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.dwRequestMicroSecPerFrame
member.summary: Requested frame rate, in microseconds. The default value is 66667, which corresponds to 15 frames per second.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.fMakeUserHitOKToCapture
member.summary: User-initiated capture flag. If this member is TRUE, AVICap displays a dialog box prompting the user to initiate capture. The default value is FALSE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.wPercentDropForError
member.summary: Maximum allowable percentage of dropped frames during capture. Values range from 0 to 100. The default value is 10.

summary.para: Yield flag. If this member is TRUE, the capture window spawns a separate background thread to perform step and streaming capture. The default value is FALSE.
Applications that set this flag must handle potential reentry issues because the controls in the application are not disabled while capture is in progress.
Maximum number of index entries in an AVI file. Values range from 1800 to 324,000. If set to 0, a default value of 34,952 (32K frames plus a proportional number of audio buffers) is used.
Each video frame or buffer of waveform-audio data uses one index entry. The value of this entry establishes a limit for the number of frames or audio buffers that can be captured.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.wChunkGranularity
member.summary: Logical block size, in bytes, of an AVI file. The value 0 indicates the current sector size is used as the granularity.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.fUsingDOSMemory
member.summary: Not used in Win32 applications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.wNumVideoRequested
member.summary: Maximum number of video buffers to allocate. The memory area to place the buffers is specified with fUsingDOSMemory. The actual number of buffers allocated might be lower if memory is unavailable.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.fCaptureAudio
member.summary: Capture audio flag. If this member is TRUE, audio is captured during streaming capture. This is the default value if audio hardware is installed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.wNumAudioRequested
member.summary: Maximum number of audio buffers to allocate. The maximum number of buffers is 10.

summary.para: Virtual keycode used to terminate streaming capture. The default value is VK_ESCAPE. You must call the RegisterHotKey function before specifying a keystroke that can abort a capture session.
You can combine keycodes that include CTRL and SHIFT keystrokes by using the logical OR operator with the keycodes for CTRL (0x8000) and SHIFT (0x4000).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.fAbortLeftMouse
member.summary: Abort flag for left mouse button. If this member is TRUE, streaming capture stops if the left mouse button is pressed. The default value is TRUE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.fAbortRightMouse
member.summary: Abort flag for right mouse button. If this member is TRUE, streaming capture stops if the right mouse button is pressed. The default value is TRUE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.fLimitEnabled
member.summary: Time limit enabled flag. If this member is TRUE, streaming capture stops after the number of seconds in wTimeLimit has elapsed. The default value is FALSE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.wTimeLimit
member.summary: Time limit for capture, in seconds. This parameter is used only if fLimitEnabled is TRUE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.fMCIControl
member.summary: MCI device capture flag. If this member is TRUE, AVICap controls an MCI-compatible video source during streaming capture. MCI-compatible video sources include VCRs and laserdiscs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.fStepMCIDevice
member.summary: MCI device step capture flag. If this member is TRUE, step capture using an MCI device as a video source is enabled. If it is FALSE, real-time capture using an MCI device is enabled. (If fMCIControl is FALSE, this member is ignored.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.dwMCIStartTime
member.summary: Starting position, in milliseconds, of the MCI device for the capture sequence. (If fMCIControl is FALSE, this member is ignored.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.dwMCIStopTime
member.summary: Stopping position, in milliseconds, of the MCI device for the capture sequence. When this position in the content is reached, capture ends and the MCI device stops. (If fMCIControl is FALSE, this member is ignored.)

summary.para: Double-resolution step capture flag. If this member is TRUE, the capture hardware captures at twice the specified resolution. (The resolution for the height and width is doubled.)
Enable this option if the hardware does not support hardware-based decimation and you are capturing in the RGB format.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.wStepCaptureAverageFrames
member.summary: Number of times a frame is sampled when creating a frame based on the average sample. A typical value for the number of averages is 5.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.dwAudioBufferSize
member.summary: Audio buffer size. If the default value of zero is used, the size of each buffer will be the maximum of 0.5 seconds of audio or 10K bytes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.fDisableWriteCache
member.summary: Not used in Win32 applications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.CAPTUREPARMS.AVStreamMaster
member.summary: Indicates whether the audio stream controls the clock when writing an AVI file. If this member is set to AVSTREAMMASTER_AUDIO, the audio stream is considered the master stream and the video stream duration is forced to match the audio duration. If this member is set to AVSTREAMMASTER_NONE, the durations of audio and video streams can differ.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.DRAWDIBTIME
member.summary: The DRAWDIBTIME structure contains elapsed timing information for performing a set of DrawDib operations. The DrawDibTime function resets the count and the elapsed time value for each operation each time it is called.

summary.para: Number of times the following operations have been performed since DrawDibTime was last called:

item.term: Draw a bitmap on the screen.
Transfer bitmap data by using the BitBlt function.
Transfer bitmap data by using the SetDIBits function.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIEditStream
member.summary: The IAVIEditStream interface supports manipulating and modifying editable streams. Uses IUnknown::QueryInterface, IUnknown::AddRef, IUnknown::Release in addition to the following custom methods:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIEditStream.Cut(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The Cut method removes a portion of a stream and places it in a temporary stream. Called when an application uses the EditStreamCut function.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives the starting position of the operation.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the length, in frames, of the operation.
member.returns: Pointer to a buffer that receives a pointer to the interface to the new stream.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIEditStream.Copy(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The Copy method copies a stream or a portion of it to a temporary stream. Called when an application uses the EditStreamCopy function.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives the starting position of the operation.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the length, in frames, of the operation.
member.returns: Pointer to a buffer that receives a pointer to the interface to the new stream.

member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives the starting position of the operation.

Pointer to the interface to the source stream.
Starting position of the copy operation within the source stream.
Ending position of the copy operation within the source stream.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIFile
member.summary: The IAVIFile interface supports opening and manipulating files and file headers, and creating and obtaining stream interfaces. Uses IUnknown::QueryInterface, IUnknown::AddRef, and IUnknown::Release in addition to the following custom methods:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIFile.Info(Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.AVIFILEINFO@,System.Int32)
member.summary: The Info method returns with information about an AVI file. Called when an application uses the AVIFileInfo function.
member.param: A pointer to an AVIFILEINFO structure. The method fills the structure with information about the file.
The size, in bytes, of the buffer specified by pfi.

remarks.para: If the buffer allocated is too small for the structure, this method should fail the call by returning AVIERR_BUFFERTOOSMALL. Otherwise, it should fill the structure and return its size.

member.summary: The FindSample method obtains the position in a stream of a key frame or a nonempty frame. Called when an application uses the AVIStreamFindSample function.
member.param: Position of the sample or frame.

param.name: lFlags
param.para: Applicable flags. The following values are defined.

item.term: Searches forward through a stream, beginning with the current frame.
Searches backward through a stream, beginning with the current frame.

param.para: The FIND_ANY, FIND_KEY, and FIND_FORMAT flags are mutually exclusive, as are the FIND_NEXT and FIND_PREV flags. You must specify one value from each group.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream.ReadFormat(System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The ReadFormat method obtains format information from a stream. Fills and returns a structure with the data in an application-defined buffer. If no buffer is supplied, determines the buffer size needed to retrieve the buffer of format data. Called when an application uses the AVIStreamReadFormat function.
member.param: Position of the sample or frame.
Pointer to the buffer for the format data. Specify NULL to request the required size of the buffer.

Pointer to a buffer that receives the size, in bytes, of the buffer specified by lpFormat. When this method is called, the contents of this parameter indicates the size of the buffer specified by lpFormat. When this method returns control to the application, the contents of this parameter specifies the amount of data read or the required size of the buffer.

remarks.para: The type of data stored in a stream dictates the format information and the structure that contains the format information. A stream handler should return all applicable format information in this structure, including palette information when the format uses a palette. A stream handler should not return stream data with the structure.

Standard video stream handlers provide format information in a BITMAPINFOHEADER structure. Standard audio stream handlers provide format information in a PCMWAVEFORMAT structure. Other data streams can use other structures that describe the stream data.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.AviFil32.IAVIStream.SetFormat(System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)

remarks.para: Standard video stream handlers provide format information in a BITMAPINFOHEADER structure. Standard audio stream handlers provide format information in a PCMWAVEFORMAT structure. Other data streams can use other structures that describe the stream data.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32
member.summary: Items from the Vfw32.dll
Items from the Vfw32.dll

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capControlCallback

summary.para: The capControlCallback function is the callback function used for precision control to begin and end streaming capture. The name capControlCallback is a placeholder for the application-supplied function name.
To set the callback, send the WM_CAP_SET_CALLBACK_CAPCONTROL message to the capture window or call the capSetCallbackOnCapControl macro.

member.param: Handle to the capture window associated with the callback function.

Current state of the capture operation. The CONTROLCALLBACK_PREROLL value is sent initially to enable prerolling of the video sources and to return control to the capture application at the exact moment recording is to begin. The CONTROLCALLBACK_CAPTURING value is sent once per captured frame to indicate that streaming capture is in progress and to enable the application to end capture.
member.returns: When nState is set to CONTROLCALLBACK_PREROLL, this callback function must return TRUE to start capture or FALSE to abort it. When nState is set to CONTROLCALLBACK_CAPTURING, this callback function must return TRUE to continue capture or FALSE to end it.
member.remarks: The first message sent to the callback procedure sets the nState parameter to CONTROLCALLBACK_PREROLL after allocating all buffers and all other capture preparations are complete.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capErrorCallback

summary.para: The capErrorCallback function is the error callback function used with video capture. The name capErrorCallback is a placeholder for the application-supplied function name.
To set the callback, send the WM_CAP_SET_CALLBACK_ERROR message to the capture window or call the capSetCallbackOnError macro.

member.param: Handle to the capture window associated with the callback function.
Error identification number.
Pointer to a textual description of the returned error.

remarks.para: A message identifier of zero indicates a new operation is starting and the callback function should clear the current error.

para.para: Note

The vfw.h header defines CAPERRORCALLBACK as an alias which automatically selects the ANSI or Unicode version of this function based on the definition of the UNICODE preprocessor constant. Mixing usage of the encoding-neutral alias with code that not encoding-neutral can lead to mismatches that result in compilation or runtime errors. For more information, see Conventions for Function Prototypes.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capStatusCallback

summary.para: The capStatusCallback function is the status callback function used with video capture. The name capStatusCallback is a placeholder for the application-supplied function name.
To set the callback, send the WM_CAP_SET_CALLBACK_STATUS message to the capture window or call the capSetCallbackOnStatus macro.

member.param: Handle to the capture window associated with the callback function.
Message identification number.
Pointer to a textual description of the returned status.

remarks.para: During capture operations, the first message sent to the callback function is always IDS_CAP_BEGIN and the last is always IDS_CAP_END. A message identifier of zero indicates a new operation is starting and the callback function should clear the current status.

para.para: Note

The vfw.h header defines CAPSTATUSCALLBACK as an alias which automatically selects the ANSI or Unicode version of this function based on the definition of the UNICODE preprocessor constant. Mixing usage of the encoding-neutral alias with code that not encoding-neutral can lead to mismatches that result in compilation or runtime errors. For more information, see Conventions for Function Prototypes.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capVideoStreamCallback

summary.para: The capVideoStreamCallback function is the callback function used with streaming capture to optionally process a frame of captured video. The name capVideoStreamCallback is a placeholder for the application-supplied function name.
To set this callback for streaming capture, send the WM_CAP_SET_CALLBACK_VIDEOSTREAM message to the capture window or call the capSetCallbackOnVideoStream macro.
To set this callback for preview frame capture, send the WM_CAP_SET_CALLBACK_FRAME message to the capture window or call the capSetCallbackOnFrame macro.

member.param: Handle to the capture window associated with the callback function.
Pointer to a VIDEOHDR structure containing information about the captured frame.
member.remarks: The capture window calls a video stream callback function when a video buffer is marked done by the capture driver. When capturing to disk, this will precede the disk write operation.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capWaveStreamCallback

summary.para: The capWaveStreamCallback function is the callback function used with streaming capture to optionally process buffers of audio data. The name capWaveStreamCallback is a placeholder for the application-supplied function name.
To set the callback, send the WM_CAP_SET_CALLBACK_WAVESTREAM message to the capture window or call the capSetCallbackOnWaveStream macro.

member.param: Handle to the capture window associated with the callback function.
Pointer to a WAVEHDR structure containing information about the captured audio data.
member.remarks: The capture window calls a wave stream callback function when an audio buffer is marked done by the waveform-audio driver. When capturing to disk, this will precede the disk write operation.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capYieldCallback

summary.para: The capYieldCallback function is the yield callback function used with video capture. The name capYieldCallback is a placeholder for the application-supplied function name.
To set the callback, send the WM_CAP_SET_CALLBACK_YIELD message to the capture window or call the capSetCallbackOnYield macro.

member.param: Handle to the capture window associated with the callback function.
member.remarks: The capture window calls the yield callback function at least once for every captured video frame, but the exact rate depends on the frame rate and the overhead of the capture driver and disk.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capCaptureAbort(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND)
member.summary: The capCaptureAbort macro stops the capture operation. You can use this macro or explictly send the WM_CAP_ABORT message.
member.param: Handle to a capture window.

remarks.para: The capture operation must yield to use this macro.
In the case of step capture, the image data collected up to the point of the capCaptureAbort macro will be retained in the capture file, but audio will not be captured.
Use the capCaptureStop macro to halt step capture at the current position, and then capture audio.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capCaptureGetSetup(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.CAPTUREPARMS@)
member.summary: The capCaptureGetSetup macro retrieves the current settings of the streaming capture parameters. You can use this macro or explictly send the WM_CAP_GET_SEQUENCE_SETUP message.
member.param: Handle to a capture window.
Pointer to a CAPTUREPARMS structure.
member.remarks: For information about the parameters used to control streaming capture, see the CAPTUREPARMS structure.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capCaptureSequence(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND)
member.summary: The capCaptureSequence macro initiates streaming video and audio capture to a file. You can use this macro or explicitly send the WM_CAP_SEQUENCE message.
member.param: Handle to a capture window.

remarks.para: If you want to alter the parameters controlling streaming capture, use the capCaptureSetSetup macro prior to starting the capture.

By default, the capture window does not allow other applications to continue running during capture. To override this, either set the fYield member of the CAPTUREPARMS structure to TRUE, or install a yield callback function.

During streaming capture, the capture window can optionally issue notifications to your application of specific types of conditions. To install callback procedures for these notifications, use the following macros:

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capCaptureSequenceNoFile(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND)
member.summary: The capCaptureSequenceNoFile macro initiates streaming video capture without writing data to a file. You can use this macro or explicitly send the WM_CAP_SEQUENCE_NOFILE message.
member.param: Handle to a capture window.

remarks.para: This message is useful in conjunction with video stream or waveform-audio stream callback functions that let your application use the video and audio data directly.
If you want to alter the parameters controlling streaming capture, use the capCaptureSetSetup macro prior to starting the capture.

By default, the capture window does not allow other applications to continue running during capture. To override this, either set the fYield member of the CAPTUREPARMS structure to TRUE, or install a yield callback function.

During streaming capture, the capture window can optionally issue notifications to your application of specific types of conditions. To install callback procedures for these notifications, use the following macros:

member.summary: The capCaptureSetSetup macro sets the configuration parameters used with streaming capture. You can use this macro or explicitly send the WM_CAP_SET_SEQUENCE_SETUP message.
member.param: Handle to a capture window.
Pointer to a CAPTUREPARMS structure.
member.remarks: For information about the parameters used to control streaming capture, see the CAPTUREPARMS structure.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capCaptureSingleFrame(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND)
member.summary: The capCaptureSingleFrame macro appends a single frame to a capture file that was opened using the capCaptureSingleFrameOpen macro. You can use this macro or explicitly send the WM_CAP_SINGLE_FRAME message.
member.param: Handle to a capture window.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capCaptureSingleFrameClose(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND)
member.summary: The capCaptureSingleFrameClose macro closes the capture file opened by the capCaptureSingleFrameOpen macro. You can use this macro or explicitly send the WM_CAP_SINGLE_FRAME_CLOSE message.
member.param: Handle to a capture window.
member.remarks: For information about installing callback functions, see the capSetCallbackOnError and capSetCallbackOnFrame macros.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capCaptureSingleFrameOpen(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND)
member.summary: The capCaptureSingleFrameOpen macro opens the capture file for single-frame capturing. Any previous information in the capture file is overwritten. You can use this macro or explicitly send the WM_CAP_SINGLE_FRAME_OPEN message.
member.param: Handle to a capture window.
member.remarks: For information about installing callback functions, see the capSetCallbackOnError and capSetCallbackOnFrame macros.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Vfw32.capCaptureStop(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND)

summary.para: The capCaptureStop macro stops the capture operation. You can use this macro or explicitly send the WM_CAP_STOP message.

In step frame capture, the image data that was collected before this message was sent is retained in the capture file. An equivalent duration of audio data is also retained in the capture file if audio capture was enabled.

member.param: Handle to a capture window.
member.remarks: The capture operation must yield to use this message. Use the capCaptureAbort macro to abandon the current capture operation.

Width of the capture window.
