member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICImageCompress(Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.HIC,System.UInt32,Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.BITMAPINFO@,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The ICImageCompress function compresses an image to a given size. This function does not require initialization functions.
member.param: Handle to a compressor opened with the ICOpen function. Specify NULL to have VCM select an appropriate compressor for the compression format. An application can have the user select the compressor by using the ICCompressorChoose function, which opens the selected compressor and returns a handle of the compressor in this parameter.
Reserved; must be zero.
Pointer to the BITMAPINFO structure containing the input data format.
Pointer to input data bits to compress. The data bits exclude header and format information.
Pointer to the BITMAPINFO structure containing the compressed output format. Specify NULL to have the compressor use an appropriate format.
Quality value used by the compressor. Values range from 0 to 10,000.

Maximum size desired for the compressed image. The compressor might not be able to compress the data to fit within this size. When the function returns, this parameter points to the size of the compressed image. Image sizes are specified in bytes.
member.returns: Returns a handle to a compressed DIB. The image data follows the format header.
member.remarks: To obtain the format information from the BITMAPINFOHEADER structure, use the GlobalLock function to lock the data. Use the GlobalFree function to free the DIB when you are finished.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICInstall(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.String,Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICINSTALL)
member.summary: The ICInstall function installs a new compressor or decompressor.
member.param: Four-character code indicating the type of data used by the compressor or decompressor. Specify "VIDC" for a video compressor or decompressor.
Four-character code identifying a specific compressor or decompressor.

Pointer to a null-terminated string containing the name of the compressor or decompressor, or the address of a function used for compression or decompression. The contents of this parameter are defined by the flags set for wFlags.
Reserved; do not use.

param.name: wFlags
param.para: Flags defining the contents of lParam. The following values are defined.

item.term: The lParam parameter contains the address of a null-terminated string that names the compressor to install.
The lParam parameter contains the address of a compressor function. This function should be structured like the DriverProc entry point function used by compressors.

member.returns: Returns ICERR_OK if successful or an error otherwise.

remarks.para: Applications must open an installed compressor or decompressor before using it.

If your application installs a function as a compressor or decompressor, it should remove the function with the ICRemove function before it terminates. This prevents other applications from trying to access the function when it is not available.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICLocate(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.BITMAPINFOHEADER@,Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.BITMAPINFOHEADER@,Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICMODE)
member.summary: The ICLocate function finds a compressor or decompressor that can handle images with the specified formats, or finds a driver that can decompress an image with a specified format directly to hardware.
member.param: Four-character code indicating the type of compressor or decompressor to open. For video streams, the value of this parameter is 'VIDC'.

Preferred handler of the specified type. Typically, the handler type is stored in the stream header in an AVI file. Specify NULL if your application can use any handler type or it does not know the handler type to use.
Pointer to a BITMAPINFOHEADER structure defining the input format. A compressor handle is not returned unless it supports this format.

param.name: lpbiOut
param.para: Pointer to a BITMAPINFOHEADER structure defining an optional decompressed format. You can also specify zero to use the default output format associated with the input format.
If this parameter is nonzero, a compressor handle is not returned unless it can create this output format.

param.name: wFlags
param.para: Flags that describe the search criteria for a compressor or decompressor. The following values are defined:

item.term: Finds a compressor that can compress an image with a format defined by lpbiIn to the format defined by lpbiOut.
Finds a decompressor that can decompress an image with a format defined by lpbiIn to the format defined by lpbiOut.
Finds a decompressor that can decompress an image with a format defined by lpbiIn and draw it directly to hardware.
Has the same meaning as ICMODE_COMPRESS except the compressor is used for a real-time operation and emphasizes speed over quality.
Has the same meaning as ICMODE_DECOMPRESS except the decompressor is used for a real-time operation and emphasizes speed over quality.

member.returns: Returns a handle to a compressor or decompressor if successful or zero otherwise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICSeqCompressFrame(Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS@,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The ICSeqCompressFrame function compresses one frame in a sequence of frames.
member.param: Pointer to a COMPVARS structure initialized with information about the compression.
Reserved; must be zero.
Pointer to the data bits to compress. (The data bits exclude header or format information.)
Returns whether or not the frame was compressed into a key frame.

Maximum size desired for the compressed image. The compressor might not be able to compress the data to fit within this size. When the function returns, the parameter points to the size of the compressed image. Images sizes are specified in bytes.
member.returns: Returns the address of the compressed bits if successful or NULL otherwise.

remarks.para: This function uses a COMPVARS structure to provide settings for the specified compressor and intersperses key frames at the rate specified by the ICSeqCompressorFrameStart function. You can specify values for the data rate for the sequence and the key-frame frequency by using the appropriate members of COMPVARS.
Use this function instead of the ICCompress function to compress a video sequence.
You can allow the user to specify a compressor and initialize a COMPVARS structure by using the ICCompressorChoose function. Or, you can initialize a COMPVARS structure manually.

Use the ICSeqCompressFrameStart, ICSeqCompressFrame, and ICSeqCompressFrameEnd functions to compress a sequence of frames to a specified data rate and number of key frames. Use ICSeqCompressFrame once for each frame to be compressed.
When finished with compression, use the ICCompressorFree function to release the resources specified by COMPVARS.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICSeqCompressFrameEnd(Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS@)
member.summary: The ICSeqCompressFrameEnd function ends sequence compression that was initiated by using the ICSeqCompressFrameStart and ICSeqCompressFrame functions.
member.param: Pointer to a COMPVARS structure used during sequence compression.
member.returns: This function does not return a value.
member.remarks: When finished with compression, use the ICCompressorFree function to release the resources specified by COMPVARS.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICSeqCompressFrameStart(Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS@,System.IntPtr)

member.param: Pointer to a COMPVARS structure initialized with information for compression.
Format of the data to be compressed.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if successful or FALSE otherwise.

remarks.para: This function uses a COMPVARS structure to provide settings for the specified compressor and intersperses key frames at the rate specified by the lKey member of COMPVARS. You can specify values for the data rate for the sequence and the key-frame frequency by using the appropriate members of COMPVARS.
Use the ICSeqCompressFrameStart, ICSeqCompressFrame, and ICSeqCompressFrameEnd functions to compress a sequence of frames to a specified data rate and number of key frames.
When finished with compression, use the ICCompressorFree function to release the resources specified in COMPVARS.

COMPVARS needs to be initialized before you use this function. You can initialize the structure manually or you can allow the user to specify a compressor and initialize a COMPVARS structure by using the ICCompressorChoose function.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.StretchDIB(Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.BITMAPINFOHEADER@,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.Gdi32.BITMAPINFOHEADER@,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The StretchDIB function copies a device independent bitmap from one memory location to another and resizes the image to fit the destination rectangle.
member.param: Pointer to a BITMAPINFOHEADER structure that describes the destination bitmap.
Pointer to the memory buffer that will receive the copied pixel bits.
X coordinate of the destination rectangle's origin.
Y coordinate of the destination rectangle's origin.
Width, in pixels, of the destination rectangle.
Height, in pixels, of the destination rectangle.
Pointer to a BITMAPINFOHEADER structure that describes the source bitmap.
Pointer to the source bitmap data.
X coordinate of the source rectangle's origin.
Y coordinate of the source rectangle's origin.
Width, in pixels, of the source rectangle.
Height, in pixels, of the source rectangle.

remarks.para: The size of the destination buffer must be large enough to accommodate any alignment bytes at the end of each pixel row.
This function does nothing if biSrc and biDst have different values for biBitCount or if the value for biSrc. biBitCount does not equal 8, 16, or 24.
This function performs no dithering or other smoothing. Pixel values are merely dropped or duplicated on a line-by-line, column-by-column basis.

This function does not do any special processing based on pixel encoding except for calculating the number of bits per pixel. In particular this function will not generate correct results when pixels are encoded in groups of more than 1 pixel, as in the case of a YUV format where U and V are decimated and so are not represented equally in each pixel.
Before including Vfw.h, you must add the following line to your code:

para.code: #define DRAWDIB_INCLUDE_STRETCHDIB

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS
member.summary: The COMPVARS structure describes compressor settings for functions such as ICCompressorChoose, ICSeqCompressFrame, and ICCompressorFree.
member.remarks: You can let ICCompressorChoose fill the contents of this structure or you can do it manually. If you manually fill the structure, you must provide information for the following members: cbSize, hic, lpbiOut, lKey, and lQ. Also, you must set the ICMF_COMPVARS_VALID flag in the dwFlags member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.cbSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of this structure. This member must be set to validate the structure before calling any function using this structure.

summary.para: Applicable flags. The following value is defined:

item.term: Data in this structure is valid and has been manually entered. Set this flag before you call any function if you fill this structure manually. Do not set this flag if you let ICCompressorChoose initialize this structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.hic
member.summary: Handle to the compressor to use. You can open a compressor and obtain a handle of it by using the ICOpen function. You can also choose a compressor by using ICCompressorChoose. ICCompressorChoose opens the chosen compressor and returns the handle of the compressor in this member. You can close the compressor by using ICCompressorFree.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.fccType
member.summary: Type of compressor used. Currently only ICTYPE_VIDEO (VIDC) is supported. This member can be set to zero.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.fccHandler
member.summary: Four-character code of the compressor. Specify NULL to indicate the data is not to be recompressed. Specify "DIB" to indicate the data is an uncompressed, full frame. You can use this member to specify which compressor is selected by default when the dialog box is displayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.lpbiIn
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.lpbiOut
member.summary: Pointer to a BITMAPINFO structure containing the image output format. You can specify a specific format to use or you can specify NULL to use the default compressor associated with the input format. You can also set the image output format by using ICCompressorChoose.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.lpBitsOut
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.lpBitsPrev
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.lFrame
member.summary: Reserved; do not use.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.lKey
member.summary: Key-frame rate. Specify an integer to indicate the frequency that key frames are to occur in the compressed sequence or zero to not use key frames. You can also let ICCompressorChoose set the key-frame rate selected in the dialog box. The ICSeqCompressFrameStart function uses the value of this member for making key frames.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.lDataRate
member.summary: Data rate, in kilobytes per second. ICCompressorChoose copies the selected data rate from the dialog box to this member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.COMPVARS.lQ
member.summary: Quality setting. Specify a quality setting of 1 to 10,000 or specify ICQUALITY_DEFAULT to use the default quality setting. You can also let ICCompressorChoose set the quality value selected in the dialog box. ICSeqCompressFrameStart uses the value of this member as its quality setting.

member.summary: The ICDECOMPRESS structure contains decompression parameters used with the ICM_DECOMPRESS message.

summary.para: Applicable flags. The following values are defined:

Current frame is not a key frame.
Current frame does not contain data and the decompressed image should be left the same.
Current frame precedes the point in the movie where playback starts and, therefore, will not be drawn.
Screen is being updated or refreshed.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICDRAW
member.summary: The ICDRAW structure contains parameters for drawing video data to the screen. This structure is used with the ICM_DRAW message.

summary.para: Flags from the AVI file index. The following values are defined:

item.term: Data is buffered and not drawn to the screen. Use this flag for fastest decompression.
Current frame is not a key frame.
Current frame does not contain any data, and the previous frame should be redrawn.

Current frame of video occurs before playback should start. For example, if playback will begin on frame 10, and frame 0 is the nearest previous key frame, frames 0 through 9 are sent to the driver with this flag set. The driver needs this data to display frame 10 properly.
Updates the screen based on data previously received. In this case, lpData should be ignored.

member.summary: Pointer to a structure containing the data format. For video streams, this is a BITMAPINFOHEADER structure.

member.summary: Pointer to the data to render.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICDRAW.cbData
member.summary: Number of data bytes to render.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICDRAW.lTime
member.summary: Time, in samples, when this data should be drawn. For video data this is normally a frame number.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICDRAWBEGIN
member.summary: The ICDRAWBEGIN structure contains decompression parameters used with the ICM_DRAW_BEGIN message.

summary.para: Applicable flags. The following values are defined:

item.term: Buffers this data off-screen; it will need to be updated.
Drawing is a continuation of the previous frame.
Draws the decompressed data on the full screen.
Draws the decompressed data to a window or a DC.
Determines if the decompressor can handle the decompression. The driver does not actually decompress the data.
Renders but does not draw the data.
Current frame is being updated rather than played.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICINFO
member.summary: The ICINFO structure contains compression parameters supplied by a video compression driver. The driver fills or updates the structure when it receives the ICM_GETINFO message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICINFO.dwSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the ICINFO structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICINFO.fccType
member.summary: Four-character code indicating the type of stream being compressed or decompressed. Specify "VIDC" for video streams.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICINFO.fccHandler
member.summary: A four-character code identifying a specific compressor.

summary.para: Applicable flags. Zero or more of the following flags can be set:

item.term: Driver is requesting to compress all frames. For information about compressing all frames, see the ICM_COMPRESS_FRAMES_INFO message.
Driver supports compressing to a frame size.
Driver can perform temporal compression and maintains its own copy of the current frame. When compressing a stream of frame data, the driver doesn't need image data from the previous frame.
Driver can perform temporal decompression and maintains its own copy of the current frame. When decompressing a stream of frame data, the driver doesn't need image data from the previous frame.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICINFO.dwVersion
member.summary: Version number of the driver.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICINFO.dwVersionICM
member.summary: Version of VCM supported by the driver. This member should be set to ICVERSION.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICINFO.szName
member.summary: Short version of the compressor name. The name in the null-terminated string should be suitable for use in list boxes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICINFO.szDescription
member.summary: Long version of the compressor name.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICINFO.szDriver
member.summary: Name of the module containing VCM compression driver. Normally, a driver does not need to fill this out.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICOPEN
member.summary: The ICOPEN structure contains information about the data stream being compressed or decompressed, the version number of the driver, and how the driver is used.
member.remarks: This structure is passed to video capture drivers when they are opened. This allows a single installable driver to function as either an installable compressor or a video capture device. By examining the fccType member of the ICOPEN structure, the driver can determine its function. For example, a fccType value of "VIDC" indicates that it is opened as an installable video compressor.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICOPEN.dwSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICOPEN.fccType
member.summary: Four-character code indicating the type of stream being compressed or decompressed. Specify "VIDC" for video streams.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICOPEN.fccHandler
member.summary: Four-character code identifying a specific compressor.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.Msvfw32.ICOPEN.dwVersion
member.summary: Version of the installable driver interface used to open the driver.

summary.para: Applicable flags indicating why the driver is opened. The following values are defined:

item.term: Driver is opened to compress data.
Driver is opened to decompress data.
Device driver is opened to decompress data directly to hardware.
Driver is opened for informational purposes, rather than for compression.
